body.p:
I avail myself of the first leisure moment to devote it
to you Your long & I may add painful Letter dated
the 4th inst came duly to hand I say painful for it
is to me to notice from your remarks that after
so many years as you have laboured in the Jewish
Cause our people do not appreciate your worth
if they do they take a strange way of showing it. Mr
Jonas sent me a number of plain & Gilt Bibles & I have
only disposed of one ($2.00) Your offer to issue a weekly
paper & not a simple prospect is returned to you. this
is under cause for your serious reflection & I sincerely
trust & hope you will be induced to enter the Ministry
again by your friends in Phild. offering you every inducement
to do so. See what time I have had your Books
on hand & fearing the Dampness of the climate might
ruin them was the cause of my selling a sett to Mr
Kursheedt for $20.00. but thus far he has failed to pay
for them. I want you to write a feeling letter to
John M Bach requesting him to pay his dues
to the Occident He is well off & your request
may have more effect than my frequent solicitation
tell him your situation burnt out &c & send Bill
at same time, I should be sorry to see you retire from
the field of Literature nothing would be more pleasing
to your Enemies but still with no limited encouragement

it would with disgust drive 99 our of 100 to the determination not
to cater any longer for our people. You must not blame
all for I know many that would willingly become
subscribers to your New York but they are
so heavily taxed to support our various Institutions
besides being Members of other associations that
they (say) cannot afford to increase their expenses
Its useless to refer back to what is past but I
cannot refrain from here alluding to the advice I
gave you some few years since to give your reading
lighter matter stories “to be continued” &c. You
are no longer in the era of years ago & must
conform to what makes man act contra to his
sober & better calculations. Ask your subscription
List of the Occident on how many of our Sincerely Religious
Jews it depends on to support the Occident. Hence
the necessity of dropping so much Heavy matter
which I will candidly tell you I never read
nor do I believe any other Individual in
this City. what then is to induce new subscribers
or to retain the present ones now Leeser this I
tell you. The Advocate must appear & take
my advice unless you intend to Drop the Co?nomer
of Editor. You must drop the Occident
& in its stead send the Advocate to every
Subscriber start not at my proposition
your Enemies can yet be outflanked if you will
go to work right give us the Advocate &
in it if possible a sheet in the German
Language & I will stake my Existence on
your Subscription list soon equalling your best

should you conclude to publish the Advocate I wish
to send you a list of many in the Country—to send
the first number to, I have read the two first numbers
of the Voice of Israel published by Revd Mr Bien? &
Henr Labatt at San Francisco. Have you hear
favoured with the same. Since you first started a Jewish
Periodical how many has allowed; Our Home for
Jewish Widows & Orphans is steadily increasing in its
number of Inmates & if they increase so rappidly
in a short period additional Buildings will be
required. I presume the Anniversary will be
the 8th January/57 being the day of its Dedication
We give no Dinner but with an oration (I presume
Gerthom?) & a light repast shall pass the day with
the Widows and Orphans,. I have no other news to write
“local” I feel proud of the Board Elected
by the Pourtugese Congregation. Mr Jonas
attending the school & no doubt with the other
officers will do all they can for the Interest
of the Institution to show you how they appreciate
Gutheim?. The Congregation have just increased
my Salary from $2000 to $2400 a year with
the Letter informing him of this fact the same time
a Letter of approval of his Course during the
period they have had him with them the letter
concludes “Wishing you Recd. In long life &
Happiness I am further instructed to inform
you that the Board of Officers are instructed
to furnish you with what means you may
require to furnish your House now completed
& ready for your occupancy Signed

p.rend: The following is written in pencil at the bottom of the page.

body.p:
I may not give you the exact words for the substance
as I hurried to read over them. I need not tell you
our worthy friend Gutheim is highly pleased & deservedly
so; for he is a fine young man & we all love
him. The Rev Mr Seine is a candidate for
Reelection but I shall not vote for him
He is not the man I like for a Minister
If Mr a Block wishes a copy of Dias's
Letters He knows where I am & so excuse
me I will not send it to Him
I cannot & will not humour there pople
(you mean Mr a Block in this city do you not)—
well I must close my time is so occupied
as to prevent my writing to any but yourself
in private matters so excuse my hurried
scrawl. Beleive me Leeser your
ever devoted friend
Miss Hart & family I am in Love
